intro: Acinodendron inaequidens, commonly known as the unequal-leaf acinodendron, is a shrub native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that vary in size and shape along the stems. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, often with four petals. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its dissemination in natural habitats.
